newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends mixed, hedging dents nearbys.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends mixed, hedging dents nearbys.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures settled mixed amid heavy volume as hedge pressure tied to an increase in country movement weighed on nearby contracts, traders said.
Spillover pressure from CBOT and KCBT May contracts also weighed on the front end in Minneapolis.
"We saw liquidation of May due to commercial hedging," a MGE floor source said. "Bear spreading between May and September helped support new crop."
Traders said ongoing concern about planting delays in the northern Plains also buoyed new crop values.

MGE spring wheat futures settled five cents per bushel lower to 2-1/4 cents higher, with May down five cents at $4.45 a bushel. July lost 1/4 cent to settle at $4.41-3/4, but Sept gained 3/4 cent to close at $4.40-1/2.

Traders said Linnco was a featured player, selling 800,000 bushels each of the May, July and Sept contracts. LFG also bought one million each of July and September, and bear-spread 1.5 million July/May bushels.
MGE barley futures did not trade.
